content.label: Easy to use and clean.  The food I’ve cooked is fantastic!

I really like this thermometer. I would suggest the ambient probe for anyone that does long smokes. I use mine overnight and the alarms are enough to wake me up if things get out of range. 

The thermometer can be used with presets, custom sets, exact temps or ranges. Overall I have been very happy.
It is awesome!

The app is getting better but I’d still like to see a few things:

- ability to set high and low temp alarms
- landscape mode
- 180 degree rotation when you flip the phone around. Because of the need to power my phone (or ipad) while doing a long smoke (say a 12+ hr pork butt), I need to power the device, which requires me to orient the device with the power cord facing up. With the screen not flipping around (like most apps do), the info is upside down. Landscape mode would also fix this as I could lay my device on its side while plugged in).
This app/thermometer is a must have for all Grills. The interface is easy to navigate, the thermometer syncs very well, and it keeps close tabs on how the meat is cooking in the grill. Awesome!

This is my second review. I am floored on how bad the range is on this. On a straight line of sight the range might be as much as 25 feet, however, if there is a wall between you and the probe the range is cut down to approximately 15 feet. I tried replacing the battery, uninstalling and reinstalling the app and even turning the phone and probe off and back on to no avail. Oddly enough my first review of this was deleted???

Ever time a great product is bought by a large company they screw it up!  Is there some VP idiot there who is a clueless over paid idiot that just can’t figure it out!  Why can’t you either keep the original graphing feature or make one that zones in an out to show all the data or the last few minutes!  Get rid of the all but useless graphing functions you have!

title.label: Stop Notifying Me on Ghost Probes

content.label: The app is good but I can’t use it. It literally gives me notifications every 30 seconds about a probe that doesn’t nothing is plugged into. This needs to get fixed to be useful.

Having factory-reset this thing twice now, and not being able to find the non-existent “clear” tab in graph view, I recommend you only use this device twice per decade, when your time-temp graph might be marginally useful.

Why does this app nag me about turning on notifications EVERY. SINGLE. FREAKING. TIME. I open the app? Isn’t that against the App Store guidelines?

I have notifications turned off for a reason. Just more scummy behavior from Webber since they purchased iGrill.
My igrill disconnects in the middle of a cook nearly every time. I have no problem with my iPhone 7 disconnecting from any other Bluetooth devices.

Please put back the customizations like temperature changes and alerts.  Not all cooking is done within a box.  One more thing.  App will not connect via Bluetooth via our iPhones.  It will connect via Bluetooth to our iPad.  Even if we turn off the iPad and take the batteries out of the igrill then put them back in and get blinking blue lights for syncing to a Bluetooth device,  It will not connect to any of our iPhones and we tried multiple phones even with the idevices app downloaded and installed.   This used to work on all of our devices on the older app.

Please add landscape option for graph view. I’m using an iPad and I can’t view using portrait mode when it is plugged in charging unless it’s on a flat surface. The old version supported both landscape and portrait mode. 

Glad you added range, notifications and graphical view for all probes. Adjusted my previous 1 star to a 3. Fix orientation and we will be back to 5!

title.label: Can’t tell if the app works well or not

content.label: Unfortunately since this app does not work with apples accessibility functions, voiceover, we do not get to find out if this app works or not if we need to use voiceover. It would be nice, if this app could be fixed so that it works with apples accessibility.

UPDATE: This product is still trash. It still lacks the functionality it used to have. I complained to Webers help desk and was basically told to go away. 

Update: This product is still worthless. Still no updates from Weber. 

DO NOT PURCHASE AN IGRILL. I highly recommend returning it if you still can. 

Weber, you purchased this product and destroyed it. Why? I used to use this to smoke brisket, but now, the app is worthless and crashes after only a few minutes. The graphed are worthless. 

This app used to be great. Amazing. But, now it's trash. And, now, the igrill itself is worthless.

If you want to be successful at grilling, spend a little more money for a WiFi FireBoard.
Love Weber Grills but this Bluetooth temperature probe was a big waste of my hard earned money.

title.label: It used to be fully accessible with VoiceOver

content.label: I would have given this app 5 stars when I first purchased my iGrill Mini, but now, as a person who is blind using VoiceOver on my iPhone, the app is extremely difficult to use. I often have to get someone sighted to help confirm what is going on. If I use the same setting as the previous time, I can kind of use it. It needs serious updating for VoiceOver users.
At least in 3.2.1 you could manually type in temperature. This new version alarms at everything, and very few customizable settings. Please give us the ability to roll back  versions.
Would get five stars but the super annoying out of range notification is completely unacceptable. Extremely annoying if you are walking around the house.

title.label: App is ok but the device has much to be desired

content.label:
The app works ok, it’s the device that’s lacking. First, the probes generally only work for a short time before the wire gets broken and it registers very high or not at all. Second I mostly use it for a smoker but sometimes the grill also. Grills tend to flare up occasionally and the probes instantly melt, especially the plastic covers that are included to designate the color. Also the range between the device and the phone seems to be about 50’ or so. If I’m that close I don’t need the phone display. 
With that said I didn’t give it a 1 Star and might recommend it with the above advice.
At least 50 to 75 degrees off, and readings fluctuate wildly.   There are better options out there.
Every time I try to use the "doneness" feature it says it can't use my ambient temperature probe for doneness, yet I don't have an ambient probe, I have a meat probe.
The previous app was much better. I liked adjusting the alarm to a louder one.  Also, Bluetooth is good, but WiFi would be perfect. I could monitor my cook from anywhere. Just some feedback.

I have used this app for a year or more now and always loved it until this latest app update. No longer able to set your own temps for alarms or desired doneness. Really wish that they would switch it back.
Won’t connect to my iPhone 7.

I decide to give this review three out of five stars mainly because the installation was pretty easy and frustration free. However, when I went to go pair with my iPhone X it wouldn’t pair no matter what I did (shut off Bluetooth, turned back on, shut off the phone, restarted the igrill, etc). Just for giggles I decided to try it on my girlfriends iPhone 6s And it worked marvelously. 
With my pairing, via the igrill app, it would find the igrill, start to pair with it, the light would turn blue, and then after about 5 to 10 seconds the screen would go back to “pair device“. Unlike with the iPhone 6s, I never received the “would you like to pair with this device“ iOS alert popover. :-/

12/02/17 - STILL loses connection after I tried Webers suggestion of resetting it (again). So frustrating! Not even worth a one star 

11/24/17 Another UPDATE- Still keeps losing connection. When I tried it before the update it would lose connection right beside the base unit. When I tried it after the update by the base unit, it kept its connection. Well yesterday when I actually tried smoking with it, it lost it’s connection so many times! Tried resetting, didn’t fair much better. Such a waste!!!

11/21/17 UPDATE- app is getting better, they did finally bring back the range with the pit temp. Connectivity is also better.  

They still don’t have the battery level in this version. This feature was useful when not wanting to unnecessarily waste batteries. The ability to change the probe names is also not available in this version. Graphing still has much to be desired. How about some horizontal hash marks so one can see the temperature on the graph. Please update the online owners manual. 

I still don’t understand why they completely ruined a great app and now they’re SLOWLY “fixing” the app by bringing back features that were previously in the app
————————————————————
Constantly loses connection, newer interface and graphing isn’t as good as it used to be. Can’t set an alarm with the ambient probe for a pit temp range!! Seriously??!!! 

You say you listen and value our opinion... bring back the old app that used to work, forget the outlines of a pig and cow and just please bring back the version that worked (3.2.1).
At first, it took some getting used to with Weber's updated look but I love the functionality for doing long cooks as well as making sure I can cook my father in laws steak medium rare, every time!

title.label: Would like the old menus back

content.label: Must first say this is my favorite grilling tool. That being said, the simple cooking and temperature options that one would select have now been replaced with lists of different crazy options.  Just bring back “steak” “burgers” “chicken”. I don’t need to trying to figure out if I have an “ambassador” steak or “book” steak.   Was much simpler before to choose meat and wellness and go.

After my previous scathing review and frustration with this app since the Weber takeover, and the rendering of my original iGrill device obsolete with a recent app update, I must say that Weber’s response and support has been outstanding. They took my harsh comments in stride and handled the issue promptly, sending me a new device that is compatible with their updated app. All of their responses were prompt and courteous. The new device and app have worked fine on the first two uses, however, I must say that the app could still use some tweaking. The original iGrill app gave you a choice of alarms, which was handy as you could pick one that might be easier to hear in a noisy environment. I find the current chirping alarm with no other options to be a little annoying. It would also be nice to be able to adjust the target temp on the fly instead of having to start over, if you decide that you or a guest would like their food a little more done. Fortunately, the graph doesn’t start over in the case that you have to do that. I could live with those annoyances, however, if it means that I don’t run into surprises every time I use the app and see that the latest update forces me to have to do or relearn something just to throw some meat on the grill. Again, thanks to Weber for their outstanding support.

title.label: Went downhill after Weber took over

content.label:
Ever since the iGrill app has been taken over by Weber it’s going down hill
The meat selection is horrible they have a million kind of fancy meat cut that you never ever use but a simple hamburger is no longer available the original iGrill app even looked nicer with the home page having actual pictures of the first selection.
There should be a list with last used items besides the favorites.
The zoom function on the graph is also not what is use to be especially how far you can zoom in on the temperature.

Weber used to be something now it’s just a name where they can charge more for mediocre items.
But it’s not there yet. I have to disconnect and reconnect in order to get the updated temp on the app

Remember the "Happy Cooker", an excellent barbecue from the '70s; hinged dome, large cooking surface, self-cleaning, and it lasted twenty years before I needed to replace some parts. Weber bought them out, discontinued the replacement parts, making the grill unusable. Furthermore, Weber did not adopt any of the benefits and features the Happy Cooker was noted for...
Like many of you, I researched several temperature monitoring systems before I bought the iGrill2 from iDevices; very happy with decision, it would work well for my long, low, and slow cooks on my smoker, it was not purchased to grill steaks, I can do that without a probe or graph. I am suffering from the same functionality issues as everyone here reviewing this APP, including a loss pairing at short range and I have no real consistency on long range. This APP makes this device completely useless for my intended use. I was happy, but, alas, I no longer am. Weber, it would be nice to see you learn from your decades of business in the grilling business...

Amendment: Please bring back the iDevice APP for the iGrill 2 NOW!!! At least it worked! You can use the new buyers for your acquired iGrill 2 for experimentation and let us old timers get by with a superior product that is light years in quality, benefits, and features better than the Weber developed APP!!! Sorry, I had hoped that your responses to our concerns back in August would have been addressed and possibly improved by now, no luck...my iGrill 2 is just an expensive meat thermometer and a poor one at that...

Got the iGrill mini before it was acquired by Weber. I also have a Traeger pellet grill. Those two work pure magic with anything I smoke and/or grill. 
Unlike many others, i have zero complaints about the probe, app or connectivity between the phone and probe... just smoked a 17lbs turkey for TG, it was amazing and the probe was spot on and guided me all along. 
I like the latest update of the app, much easier to navigate the app and configure the probe, imho. 
Great job to the team maintaining this product!
Tracked the turkey temperature perfectly. Perfectly cooked bird.

Constantly disconnecting from iPhone 7 with the latest updates. Weber continues to disappoint with the iGrill mini 7032. I have to rely on this device to stay connected or else I end up ruining my family’s dinners. This contraption is just not throughly developed and shouldn’t be marketed as a reliable device.

This app has gone from bad to worse. They really need to do some usability testing. The UI is just about the worst I’ve seen. Convoluted, unintuitive, frustrating. If you don’t already own an igrill, run away. If you do, you’ll just have to suffer until they hire a real UI engineer.
Well, it looks like Weber has responded to customer feedback and has fixed the app. Well done guys!

As I sit here debating on what star rating to give this, I keep getting “out of range” notifications popping up. I’ve literally received 3 since I started typing and I’m not moving around. I understand I may be on the cusp of being in and out of range, but let me toggle my alerts some how. Or only alert me every 30 min if I’m still out of range. (Just received my 4th alert. )

I miss the way the app used to function, I only use this about once/twice year and just want it to work (like it did) now I have to turn off all alerts from this in the Apple settings (5th alert just came in) and keep checking. (6th alert) 

And every time I go into the app it’s connected fine, so I’m not sure about all these alerts, but I’d love to have this fixed.

Otherwise I feel like I bought a product I loved, then Weber came and bought that product and ruined it. Which is sad, bc I love Weber grills (7th alert).

I hope the app gets fixed, you have ruined a good thing.

What happened to this app? It used to be very accessible with VoiceOver on my iPhone. I am blind and decided to use my eye grill to monitor the temperature of my turkey in my smoker. To my disappointment, the app and it’s latest revision is not very accessible with voiceover.

title.label: Even worse... in time for thanksgiving

content.label: So I upgrade a few days ago hoping that this app would improve before I smoke a turkey. Nope. It’s worse. Constant disconnections, and can only see one probe of two if I’m lucky. Very disappointing. I cannot see how to indicate one probe as ambient, and cannot even see one of them at all. Thanksgiving will not include thanking your bug checking team. It’s much worse, and I didn’t think it could be.

I have used the iGrill mini and the app for two years now. Bought it to primarily help with smoking a turkey. And it worked great. Fast forward two years and on an early morning thanksgiving my app and thermometer went belly up. It now reads 200 degrees + the normal temperature. Kind of like an old metal probe thermometer when it gets stuck.
I guess during a recent update they took away the ability to label probes.  No idea why, but I really liked that feature.  I have a vertical smoker and liked to label but meat top, bottom etc.
The app is getting better. Weber listened to our feedback.
So happy I can use my original igrill with the app again in time for my big thanksgiving party

I’ve used the iGrill app since early spring. It was a great app then and then transformed into a very poor version over the summer. It has now crawled back to a great app. Notifications on my iPad are loud and attention getting and wake up the iPad. I haven’t put this newest version on my iPhone yet but will shortly.  Happy Thanksgiving!

title.label: Bring back landscape mode and you’re back to 5 stars

content.label: Getting better after a complete backwards move a few months back where you stripped all functionality and features. Being back landscape mode and you’re back to 2016

title.label: Way better than Webers first release app

content.label: App work way better on this release on my iPad. Notifications work way better.
This product is not up to the standard of Weber.  Would not recommend it.  Maybe igrill3 will meet expectations.  Very disappointed.

This latest app update restored those features that were taken off when Weber took over From iGrill with v4.0 update. 

The UI is still different from the old v3.9, but at least these favorite and useful features are back!

Thanks Weber for bringing back these features.
